Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of CMV pp65 mRNA-Loaded Dendritic Cell Vaccination

Trial_Design.evidence: randomised controlled trial involved four CMV-seronegative healthy volunteers and three allogeneic HSCT recipients

Participants.evidence: Conducted at Antwerp University Hospital, this randomised controlled trial involved four CMV-seronegative healthy volunteers and three allogeneic HSCT recipients

Intervention.evidence: Participants received four weekly intradermal DC vaccines, prepared from a single leukapheresis

Objective.evidence: This study investigates the safety, feasibility, and immunogenicity of CMV pp65 mRNA-loaded autologous monocyte-derived dendritic cells (DC) as a vaccine

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the induction of CMV-specific T-cell responses, evaluated one month post-vaccination

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: randomisation and allocation concealment methods were not detailed

Number_Randomised.evidence: The trial did not specify the number of participants randomised to each group

Number_Analysed.evidence: The trial did not specify the number of participants randomised to each group or the analysis approach

Result_Outcome.evidence: In healthy volunteers, three of four exhibited de novo CMV-specific T-cell responses without serious adverse events

Harms.evidence: Adverse events included transient local redness and mild swelling at the injection site, with no serious events in healthy subjects

Trial_Registration.evidence: Trial registration and funding information were not provided

Funding.evidence: Trial registration and funding information were not provided
